main_question: How is machine learning integrating with and enhancing traditional physics-based General Circulation Models (GCMs) to improve climate prediction accuracy and computational efficiency?
sub_questions: In what ways can machine learning algorithms replace or optimize sub-grid scale parameterizations in Earth System Models?
How does deep learning improve statistical downscaling techniques for regional climate risk assessment?
What are the primary challenges regarding the interpretability and physical consistency of data-driven climate models?
To what extent can hybrid modeling (physics-informed machine learning) bridge the gap between observational data and theoretical simulations?
expected_sections: ML Architectures in Climate Science (CNNs, RNNs, Transformers)
Replacing Physics with Data: ML for Parameterization
Challenges: Interpretability, Stability, and Out-of-Distribution Generalization
